item.description:
We are inviting you to help install 30 Eastern bluebird nesting boxes for the MSSF Wildlife Management Area and surrounding spots within the forest. Meet at the MSSF Headquarters picnic tables at 10:00 AM, Sunday, March 20.  We will carpool to Cutter Field RD and a few other prime real estate spots. Volunteers are needed to help monitor Eastern bluebird boxes for the season as well. If you'd like to learn how to monitor bluebird nests, send an email to madshamel@gmail.com We will be holding a monitoring training meeting very soon.

If you can't make this meeting, you can help native birds by setting up a birdhouse in your own yard. Visit the Mass Audubon website to learn more about birds and for instructions on building birdhouses for different kinds of birds. But please, only build birdhouses for native birds. Alien birds are one of the reasons our native birds are in trouble.
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet at headquarters parking lot and carpool to the sites of installation.
item.why: The Friends of Myles Standish State Forest (MSSF) Native Bird Support Group is helping bluebirds by providing them with nesting boxes in several locations in the forest. Their populations have risen in recent years due to nesting boxes!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Nesting box installation
